ygData.subject: RE: Twinking
ygData.msgSnippet: Gads I hope that is the case.  My first two regular groups ahve all but fallen apart as the various members have ditched their primary characters to play
ygData.messageBody:
Gads I hope that is the case. My first two regular groups ahve all but
fallen apart as the various members have ditched their primary characters to
play binders. It has been a depressing last month for me group wise. The
only time I grouped in the last week it was in Befallen with 2 rangers and a
cleric. The cleric blew 80% of his mana every fight nuking the undead and
the two rangers and I were forced to be healers. It was silly. If he
wanted to play a wizard why didn't he? I would dearly love to find a group
of intelligent players my level who won't be depending on me to be their
primary tank.

Kitasi of E'ci

-----Original Message-----
From: Miriana [mailto:miriana@...]
Sent: Tuesday, October 05, 1999 4:00 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Twinking


From: Miriana <miriana@...>

On Tue, 5 Oct 1999 John.Curry@... wrote:

> From: John.Curry@...
>
> Giving away banded.. doph.. the poor blacksmiths who spent all that time
> learning the craft so they could be undersold by someone giveing it away.
Read my signature below :).

> would think that the game STARTs at level 20 :) Thats when you started
> getting stuff for yourself :) Anyway, I really think that if Verant
wanted
For many of us, the game isn't about STUFF, but apparently it is
for you. Lvl 20 is around the level where current eq players are bridging
the gap between auction for a random group of similar level people, and
having a small group of friends they regularly group with. That was my
point.

Miriana Windryder
Master Smith
